This place is delicious and has a super cute patio in the back. It was a little bit tricky with the stroller, but was able to find a good spot not in the way. I had a glass of sparkling wine, a miso soup, and the egg salad. It was the …

Great food selection of bento boxes and sandos. Great quality and taste.

Love the ceramics and Japanese home goods store in the front.
Wonderful egg salad sandwich and chicken karaage at this Japanese cafe in Brooklyn. Very modern cool Japanese interior. Quiet noise. Relaxed.

Cute bento boxes and the chicken was incredible. Juicy, flavorful. Not heavy at all and the mayo / sauce was great balance. Order at the front and seating behind the curtain. Just wish there was A/C and the indoor seating wasn’t so cramped and loud.

I had high expectations knowing the reviews and accolades of the chef at Acre. However, it was sadly disappointing. Beautiful building but the food was just sub par.  Fresh and creative should not equate to peculiar and expensive. I will choose to visit other establishments in my future trips to Auburn.
Best steak Iâve had recently - celebrated a birthday which was noted in reservation and mentioned to server and met with a mere meek Happy Birthday

I had the ribeye which was very flavorful and cooked (rare) to perfection.  Karen had the gulf shrimp and etouffe which was excellent.

Our server, Walker, was outstanding.
Great selection of entrees
Nice place. Unique menu.  Staff is always great.
Butter up cake is the best!
Acre never fails to deliver.  Amazing food and atmosphere.

I've eaten at Acre often and always enjoyed it but this trip was especially lovely--our server and the other staff members were exceptional as was the food. A welcome respite on a stormy Saturday afternoon!!
Wonderful creative menu. Big servings and beautiful facility.  A must when in Auburn!!!

From the time you spot the restaurant, you know it's going to be good. The outside of the building is beautiful and the landscaping is nothing but vegetables and fruit! How amazing it is to see what you know you're about to eat. You can't get any better than seeing your food in the landscape of the establishment. The glass enclosed room is beautiful with gorgeous flooring. The inside of the entire restaurant is eye catching. To take everything in is almost exhausting - it's just beautiful! The staff is always courteous. Tables are ready and when you have a reservation, the restaurant does a great job at calling to remind you of the same. The food is impeccable. Lunch and brunch menu items vary from dinner which makes it one of those places you could easily dine at on the same day and not feel as if you're eating the same cuisine. I love how the favorites remain while other dishes change throughout the season based on availability of local vegetables, fruits and herbs. It's definitely a must-go and one of those places you should visit often as the menu changes.

opentable_description: Acre is an upscale, southern restaurant in Auburn Alabama, located just two blocks from the historic Toomer's Corner. Acre features fresh local ingredients sourced from their own gardens and local farms, and offers their guests true southern hospitality. Chef/Owner David Bancroft offers guests a diverse culinary experience and comfortable atmosphere that highlights the Auburn community.

Nice little island on the lower west side piers. It now is open and does not require booking. There is a lookout point and some seating and gathering spaces for open air concerts. Many tourists with their cameras and phones out for …

name: Round K by Sol
description: Narrow, offbeat cafe with a vintage ambiance providing latte art, house-roasted coffee & light fare.
reviews: Simple, yet diverse menu leaves you with options on what kind of meal you want! I have to go back to try the Truffle Toast, they unfortunately ran out while I was there. …

Finally had the chance to visit this spot, and I’m so glad we did. Stopped by for a quick bite, and the food and drinks didn’t disappoint—everything was delicious. The service was top-notch. We even got to meet the owner, who was really …

I absolutely love their new pocha style dining!
It was so fun and cozy, and the vibes were just immaculate! I love everything. We order, especially mackerel noodles

Service bit off , only one person helps. And kitchen close early even when we managed to book a table. And food are way too expensive as what we got, they taste just like normal Korean pup drinking food, but charge like upscale restaurants, …
Food is so delicious and authentic! Pocha vibe brings us to Korea with warm oden and noodle soup. And their soju cocktails and collection are so perfect! My fav spot in New York.
Loved every second of it! Han was great to talk with

What a special experience! Food and drinks were great! Everything on the menu was available except for one cocktail (there are many). We were warm and comfy. The person grilling and serving was so wonderful - loved hearing his experiences and his recommendations were spot on. We had fish cakes, noodle soup with mackerel, and pork belly. All were superb!

So by day, this spot is a normal cafe. But by night, it apparently turns into a Korean street food stand. You go through the cafe and to the backyard, where there's a beautiful hut hiding a chef grilling up giant shrimp and mackerel.

The seating is outdoor so dress warmly. There's some heating elements but not enough. The table seats are also a bit low so if you're not ok with that, make sure you snag a seat by the bar.

We were a bit disappointed when we got there and they told us there was no pork belly or galbi. That was literally half the menu! Halfway through our dinner, galbi became available so we ordered a grilled one.

The noodle soup and Oden were the best. Both was Seoul (get it?) warming. The giant shrimp was fresh and grilled nicely.  The chicken fried rice tasted mostly like butter unfortunately. And the grilled galbi was 90% bone and no meat.

All their cocktails are soju based. The cold brew cocktail taste like watered down coffee. But the soju mule was tasty.

Overall I'll give these guys a 3.5. I'll come back for the vibes and good service. The chef offered us more broth as we were finishing the noodles. Maybe we'll try the other dishes next time assuming they're available.

We came for dinner the other night and this was such a treat to experience a slice of Korea in NY like this. We were honestly worried about eating outside because of the cold weather but were surprised how cozy it was since they use heated tables! Very friendly staff and the perfect comfort food - we canât wait to come back again!

Since it is outdoor I was worried. When I asked the restaurant they said tables have heaters (Kotatsu japanese table heater) I decided to try! and I am so happy that I tried the unique experience! the vibe was really great and the food also good. I would recommend to my friend to visit!
Had reservations slots open but restaurant is closed on Tuesday. Many reservations were outside just waiting. Waste of time traveling and a horrible oversight on this restaurant.

reviews: So delicious, hearty, and perfectly filling. We waited a bit for a table, but the staff was very kind and made sure to get us seated before their turnover for dinner. Cute, intimate ambiance; not a ton of seating, hence the wait list. The …

I heard so many nice things about this spot; it had been on my list for a year. We set our expectations so high, and everything we had lived up to our expectations! The waiting time was 1.5 hours when we were there; we were debating quite a …

The savory soy milk is a surprise for those unfamiliar with the dish - warm, comforting and delightfully savory. The sweet, cold soy milk is equally delicious and has become a must-try for me when the weather warms up. The scallion pancake was also a great addition to the meal. It wasn’t too greasy and had a wonderful lamination.

this taiwanese brunch spot served traditional and authentic dishes that are hard to find anywhere else. the savory soy milk is almost a whole meal in itself, the crunchy dough and chili oil on top really blend it all together. i highly recommend the chili wontons, scallion pancake, and the savory soy milk!

name: Jean's
reviews: Definitely one of the coolest and liveliest spots in NYC right now! The service is friendly, attentive and professional and the food is awesome. But what truly sets this place apart is the electric atmosphere. From the upbeat music to the …

Came here for my 25th birthday dinner. Food and overall atmosphere were excellent. Service was amazing, all staff were very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Also had great service when making the reservation and changing the time later on, the team was very helpful. Will definitely be back and would highly recommend!

10/10 experience! NYC has been missing somewhere for a Sunday roast gathering, and leave it to Jean’s to overdeliver. From the fresh oysters to start, to the Yorkshire pudding and salmon, to the sticky toffee pudding, I rarely have no notes. Make sure to order a few extra sides of the thrice fried potatoes, you can thank me later.

The vibe, the food, the drinks, the service… 10/10!! Came here for a friends birthday and enjoyed every minute of it, our favorites were the lobster rolls, tuna carpaccio, burger and all the desserts. This is my new go-to spot for a fun night out or special occasions!

Here's the truth: Jean's is one of the few hyped-up restaurants in NYC where the reality EXCEEDS the hype. The vibe is cozy and sexy (like, take your Raya date here but also your fun coworkers?), the staff is all good-looking and …

Vibes are cozy and upscale. The food was delicious, unfortunately some of the cocktails were a bit off/not to our liking, but the wine choices were fantastic and the waiter was quick to make a swap. 

The team at Jeans made my birthday party extra special with a champagne toast at the end of the night! Thanks all - can't wait to come back!

Food was delicious but I felt like it was a tad overpriced for what it is, itâs very simple food, basic dishes, nothing groundbreaking. Ambience is great however we were sat next to two very annoying tables: one with guests that were screaming the whole time and another with guests that kept taking flash photography every 15 seconds. This was absurdly disturbing which to be fair ruined our time at the restaurant. Service was good, not great. We felt like we were being rushed to order everything and make decisions very quickly, it felt like they wanted us to get out of the table as soon as possible. Donât know if Iâll be coming back but itâs worth it going at least once just to try.
Missed more dessert options; try to sit at l main dining room not kitchen corridor

Jean's feels very special from the minute you walk into the door.  It's spacious and has a great vibe.  They have some interesting food items as well as standards that are very delicious.  We enjoyed an heirloom tomato salad (a special that evening that was very flavorful).  I tried the grilled vegetables entree and the portion was substantial.  Sometimes veggie dishes can be skimpy but this was not.  The pasta pomodoro was also very nice.  I wouldn't recommend ordering the bread.  It is basically two slices of bread toasted and cut in 4 pieces.  Nothing special and not worth the price.  Besides that, everything else was fabulous.  The waitstaff was attentive and kind.    It night be fun for a celebration or a special evening out. I will definitely go back.
Great service and ambiance! Portions were a bit small though.

I would have given 5 stars across the board but they didnât have the chocolate chip cookie that theyâre known for having the best in the city which was pretty disappointing! Otherwise everything was great!
Great vibes, amazing food. Went with a group of friends and it was so much fun and service was great.

title: The Back Room
meta_description: The Back Room is one of only two speakeasies in New York City that operated during Prohibition and is still in existence today. It is a timeless example of the underbelly of New York past. The original 1920’s speakeasy, known simply as The Back of Ratner’s, played host to many theater and movie actors of the “Roaring Twenties,” as well as famous gangsters of the era. These gangsters included Bugsy Siegel, Lucky Luciano and Meyer Lansky.  They were known to use the space for business meetings. The Back Room and its history has been featured in many productions, including, HBO’s “Boardwalk Empire, New York Speakeasy Tour" and NYC-TV‘s “Secrets of New York.“ It is this rich and authentic history that sets The Back Room apart from other “speakeasies” of today. Visit The Back Room and use the same hidden entrance that was used 85 years ago. Enjoy a cocktail from a teacup—the way people used to secretly drink during prohibition! The vintage 1920’s décor, period pieces and secret room behind the bookcase, provide the perfect setting for a date, birthday party, film shoot, event, or a casual night with friends. Although the characters may have changed, the energy and ambiance remain constant. You won’t see any gangsters, but you might be a guest at an event for Pearl Jam, Martha Stewart, Paul McCartney, New York Magazine, Robert Plant or Adele.  Experience it for yourself. Even though Prohibition is over, the tradition lives on at The Back Room!

Website: The Back Room is one of only two speakeasies in New York City that operated during Prohibition and is still in existence today. It is a timeless example of the underbelly of New York past. The original 1920’s speakeasy, known simply as The Back of Ratner’s, played host to many theater and movie actors of the “Roaring Twenties,” as well as famous gangsters of the era. These gangsters included Bugsy Siegel, Lucky Luciano and Meyer Lansky.  They were known to use the space for business meetings. The Back Room and its history has been featured in many productions, including, HBO’s “Boardwalk Empire, New York Speakeasy Tour" and NYC-TV‘s “Secrets of New York.“ It is this rich and authentic history that sets The Back Room apart from other “speakeasies” of today. Visit The Back Room and use the same hidden entrance that was used 85 years ago. Enjoy a cocktail from a teacup—the way people used to secretly drink during prohibition! The vintage 1920’s décor, period pieces and secret room behind the bookcase, provide the perfect setting for a date, birthday party, film shoot, event, or a casual night with friends. Although the characters may have changed, the energy and ambiance remain constant. You won’t see any gangsters, but you might be a guest at an event for Pearl Jam, Martha Stewart, Paul McCartney, New York Magazine, Robert Plant or Adele.  Experience it for yourself. Even though Prohibition is over, the tradition lives on at The Back Room!

name: I Sodi
description: Tuscan-style fare, wines & cocktails lie in store at this compact, romantic restaurant.
reviews: Luckily we got a bar seats within 1 hour, the food was really great, the pasta definitely is above average. We love the Parpadelle Limone and Faro salad, the salad is the prefect start for heavy pasta. …
Managed to walk in on a Sunday around 12:15pm and got lucky to get a spot at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and helpful with the menu. …

5/5 - loved this place and it stands up to its reputation.

Food - 5/5 …

Just like the mixed reviews on here, my experience had some hits and misses.

The highlights: parppadelle al limone was so delicious; buttery and yet …

Was excited to try I Sodi as Via Carota has impressed me on multiple occasions. I have to say I was disappointed on multiple fronts, however. I was celebrating an anniversary dinner and we had brought a special 1988 vintage thinking that …

We enjoyed an early dinner at the bar counter.   All the dishes we tried was rather simply prepared, but delicious allowing you to enjoy the flavor of the good quality ingredients.  The home made pasta was lovely, too. They reminded me how the cooking should be.  The services at the bar was excellent, too: quick, efficient, and caring.

Oh this was an amazing restaurant. Food was the fantastic but the service  was the part that pushed the score to 5/5. 
We had Tartare, Lasagna, Artichoke salads, Risotto. All super good

We come to I Sodi a few times a year and are never disappointed. We were there the night of the NYT review by coincidence and it was packed. Newer waiter was rushing us a bit, but it will settle down again and be the perfect gem of a restaurant that we love. The food is divine.

Food is excellent but staff make it very clear that they have ample regulars and you're not one of them. Left standing in doorway without anyone so much as nodding at us for literally 5 minutes. And not because we were badly dressed or behaved just to be clear, and we had a reservation at an early hour.  In fairness, the place is tiny, but the chilly attitude was most disappointing. Oh well, there are plenty of top notch restaurants where they treat new patrons beautifully.

The restaurant staff is professional and welcoming.  The restaurant itself is small and the decor is not so inviting.  Food is overpriced-better value at Villa Mosconi, Mezzogiorno, Arco Cafe.  The cacio e pepi is VERY peppery and salty-overpowers the pasta.

I Sodi was recommended to me by a friend, and his recommendation did not disappoint. We had a little bit of an early reservation, but we were greeted warmly, and our server was very kind and had a great knowledge about the food and wine. He also gave us our space and let us eat our meal, without feeling rushed, so they could sit the next table.

Definitely will go again!
Reservation was honored on time...Food and wine were very good...Loved the ripe olives served gratis...Server had a bad attitude for no apparent reason

We were seated close to 8:40pm for an 8pm reservation which we were on time for. This didn't bother us because we weren't starving or in a rush, but we should have seen it as a red flag. Staff is friendly and the white negroni and wine were great. The restaurant was busy and maybe a server or someone called out, but we shouldn't have felt the effects. The timing gaps between being served water, drinks, bread/olives and entrees were very wide. Sardine special was good but needed a squeeze of lemon. We had one bite of the rabbit and cacio e pepe and both were not good at all. The rabbit was dry and just tasted of weird pancetta. The side of cooked greens were terrible and tasted like mucky frozen spinach cooked in salted water - there was barely an afterthought of evoo and garlic. The cacio e pepe had so much black pepper that I physically had difficultly swallowing my first and only bite. Servers walked by and eyed our full plates but no one stopped to ask if anything was wrong. Our server apologized but didn't offer any solutions and dropped the check. The two entrees we barely touched should have been comped. No manager came by. At that point, our only recourse was to withhold the tip. I've never not tipped - it was an awful feeling, but I hope the restaurant is mindful and kind enough to their staff to pay out the server on the check despite the lack of tip. My boyfriend and I work in the restaurant industry. Our overall experience was absolutely abysmal.

Second time that I have been and my expectations were extremely high.  The food surpassed my expectations and I would have given this a 5 star experience had it not been for one of the staff who was incredibly rude to a member of our party.  It is extremely unfortunate as the experience otherwise was excellent and this individual ruined it.

I don't live in NYC and the only reason I came was for the Artichoke Lasagna...which they were out of sadly. The replacement dish was over salted and I barely ate any of it. Bummed as I have been trying to get back to one of my fave NYC italian spots since I moved 4 years ago only to not be happy when I left...
address: I Sodi, Christopher Street, West Village, Manhattan, New York County, City of New York, New York, 10014, United States

opentable_description:
Enjoy an authentic Italian culinary experience with a calm atmosphere and a variety of delicious offerings at I Sodi. The menu reflects elements of Florence, Italy, where the owner was born and raised. Appetizers include various salads and a selection of meat and cheese dishes. For the main course, I Sodi offers housemade pasta dishes that include spinach and ricotta ravioli and lasagna in meat or artichoke sauce. 

Those looking for other options will find Cornish hen, New York strip steak and fried chicken dishes crafted with fine herbs for a full-bodied taste. Side dishes include sautÃ©ed spinach, fried potatoes and cannellini beans to name a few options. I Sodi has a bar with drink selections that pair beautifully with the various meals.

Let me emphasize that Pastis is an outstanding choice for your weekend dining, whether you're in the mood for a leisurely brunch or a satisfying lunch. The restaurant features an extensive menu that caters to various tastes, ranging from …

I loved finding this spot. I’ve always been a fan of old school advertising. This place has piles of posters. I wish more were on display as I wanted to buy one but I’ll try online. The gentleman that helped us was kind and friendly. I recommend for anyone that loves graphic design or retro ads.
Some of us enjoyed and were impressed by the varied selection of posters. Others were not impressed with the stuff and the lack of magnets.

This is a super vintage poster store! You can find diverse styles, sizes and prices. There are a lot of options to choose from. I’ll be back soon to buy a couple of posters!

reviews: Kisa Restaurant is an absolute gem! We were lucky enough to walk in without a reservation and were warmly welcomed. The owner went above and beyond, offering us complimentary food and drinks since we traveled from out of state. The food was …

Definitely a Korean place that provides unique dine-in experience. Nice interior decor interprets the old-time Korea.

name: L’industrie Pizzeria West Village
reviews: There is always a line for this place and no chairs to sit in, but the pizzas are really good!!  There were about 12 people in front outside on the line. We waited about 15 mins and a small wait when you get to the counter. The wait staff …
Always busy, always consistently good. There’s a reason there’s a line rain or shine…and this slice is worth the wait!! …
Pro tip: come when it’s freezing temps with wind chill. No line! We went right in and had our order taken right away. …

Incredible pizza and rated very highly. I definitely recommend and it's worth waiting in line for a few slices. The pizza is thin, crispy and perfectly balanced with sauce. Theres often features they promote with special slices, but I stick …

Pizza by the slice with impeccable vibes. The cozy atmosphere with the lively energy of the open kitchen makes eating here such a fun experience. The thin-crust pizzas are absolutely chef’s kiss & packed with incredible flavors. …

name: Miss Ada
description: Chef-owned spot for contemporary Israeli and Mediterranean food plus cocktails, with backyard seating.
reviews: Miss Ada is an absolute gem in Brooklyn! The food is phenomenal, and the fish dish (daily special that wasn’t on the menu)  is a true work of art. The presentation was so stunning that we couldn’t help but admire the life of the fish—it …

Some of the best Mediterranean food that I’ve had in a while. The atmosphere instead is cozy and vibrant at the same time which not many places capture. Everything was delicious - don’t feel like you need to order a lot. Big fan of their salmon which was the show stopped for me. Looking forward to coming back soon!

My friend and I went to Miss Ada at 11am on a Saturday. My friend had been previously and requested a table in the back that has the outdoor feel without being pummeled by the cold. If you don't have a reservation, I recommend going close …

Went with coworkers for dinner. We all thought the food was excellent, especially the first dishes which were dips like hummus and muhammara. We did order two extra orders of pita after quickly going through the initial batch :) at the end we slightly struggled to finish the last dishes probably because the aforementioned extra pita 😂 …

It is in a magnificent location. The employees are very kind and attentive. The ambiance is cool. The team is a very perfect team. but they bring the appetizers in very small portions. The appetizers are very nice but they do not match the …
address: Miss Ada, 184, DeKalb Avenue, Fort Greene, Brooklyn, Kings County, City of New York, New York, 11217, United States
combined_description: Google Maps: Chef-owned spot for contemporary Israeli and Mediterranean food plus cocktails, with backyard seating.

name: Good Thanks Cafe
description: Easygoing hangout offering brunch staples, sandwiches & açaí bowls, plus coffee, cocktails & wine.
reviews: Good Thanks is an absolute gem on Orchard Street, blending laid-back vibes with delicious, wholesome food. I stopped by for brunch and was impressed with every bite. All the dishes were very hardy but healthy and reasonably priced for the …

10/5 Stars. This place is amazing. Breakfast sandwich was top notch and the Harissa eggs might be the best breakfast dish ive ever tasted. Coffee and Tea were both high quality and delicious! Service was prompt and friendly, I genuinely can't recommend this place highly enough.

Came here on a public holiday for brunch and we had to wait more than an hour for a table - that’s within norms for NY but it was annoying to come back and realize that we still had to wait an additional 20 minutes because the staff didn’t …
It was the best choice in NYC for breakfasts! We were there four times during our stay in the city. Always gorgeous!

Just visited NYC and this Cafe was an absolute standout.
The people are lovely and the food and coffee was great. I had the short rib sandwich which blew my mind. …
combined_description: Google Maps: Easygoing hangout offering brunch staples, sandwiches & açaí bowls, plus coffee, cocktails & wine.

name: From Lucie
reviews: It's always a joy to stop by From Lucie, and it's on my list to visit each time I'm in New York — the perfect treat each time. The space is tiny but cozy, and the staff is kind. Looking back on photos I've taken from previous visits, it …

Nestled in Manhattan’s East Village at 263 E 10th St, From Lucie is a charming bakery that brings a slice of the French countryside to the city. Open daily from 10 am to 7 pm, this quaint spot has quickly become a favorite among locals and …

Amazing cakes and great staff! The cakes are delicious and the jam on top was perfect, not too sweet and a nice balance to the flavors. I got the vegan vanilla with earl grey buttercream and you can really taste the earl grey. The flowers of the cake make them almost too pretty to eat. Great taste, would totally go again!

Walked to this place after seeing it all over my instagram for a while and it being on my list. It was fine. They had a few cakes in stock , but I didn’t feel like spending $11 yet didn’t want to leave without getting anything so I went …

Lucie made my 21st birthday cake when she first opened, even before she had online ordering. She was beyond amazing, and since then, I've been a regular, picking up cookies and mini cakes for friends and family—everyone, of all ages, loves them! I'm so grateful for her kindness in making my birthday cake when she was just opening.

name: Wayla
description: Homestyle Thai fare inspired by the markets of Bangkok is served in a stylish space with a patio.
reviews: Came here for Sunday brunch and we were the first party to be seated. Overall experience was decent but nothing that would make me want to come back. Service was patchy and they couldn’t serve some drinks because they didn’t have hot water. …

I would like to come here at least once a month. And I intend to order the same dishes every time because they are perfection. Great service and classic NYC basement dining vibes. Super cute patio with strong lights in the backyard too
This is one of the really good underrated Thai restaurants here in New York City. …

Ambiance: good, a bit dark but nice kinda fancy. small but not crazy for ny

Food: everything we ordered was solid across the board but theres a lot of good …

Very good food, especially the tender ribs and the branzino. The vegetable curry didn't taste much like curry and had way too much potato. The waiter was friendly and attentive. The ambiance is nice, the lights are dim. They constantly play loud music so the noise level is high.
address: Wayla, 100, Forsyth Street, East Village, Manhattan Community Board 3, Manhattan, New York County, City of New York, New York, 10002, United States
title: wayla
combined_description: Google Maps: Homestyle Thai fare inspired by the markets of Bangkok is served in a stylish space with a patio.

name: Supermoon Bakehouse
description: Bakery for cruffins (croissant muffins with different fillings) & other imaginative treats.
reviews: Great bakery with a nice minimalist decor. No place to sit and eat so it is takeout only. Things sell out quick so get there early if there’s something you want. Everything I had was great. Would recommend!

Cool spot and interior. I also love the idea of seasonal flavors and pastries. The banana banoffee pastry was spectacular!!!!  The only comment i would have is the fact that there is no seating area nor coffee, other than that it is a 10/10

I visited once long time ago and remember they had nice pastry selections but with some space to improve. This time it was the same.
It’s a take-out place only, and staff were friendly and nice. …

Supermoon Bakehouse is worth every bit of its hype. I haven’t been back for a long time, and their laminated pastries once again wowed me. At my first bite, I knew it was a real delicacy, the BEST croissant I’ve had in a while. …

Super inviting chic boulangerie in the trendy LES neighborhood. Hidden in plain sight super inviting and intriguing when you walk by your view is just a table of delicate delicious pastries that are undeniably fantastic. Creative twist on …
address: Supermoon Bakehouse, 120, Rivington Street, Lower East Side, Manhattan Community Board 3, Manhattan, New York County, City of New York, New York, 10002, United States

name: C as in Charlie
reviews: Highlights here - service and welcome. Just really lovely staff. The food is pretty good, especially the fried chicken. The pasta wasn't as good as I'd hoped, but not terrible. Ditto the ribs, not brilliant but tasty enough. But the vibes here are great, and the service is perfect. Very enjoyable.

@c.asincharlie is a Korean fusion styled tapas restaurant, so their food is best shared with about 2-3 plates per person. Service was friendly and food came really fast (plates were taken away a bit too fast), and our waitress was very kind …

Intimate space, I’d recommend the spring rolls and the fried chicken.

Both steak and ribs were underwhelming and so was the pasta. Beef tartar was ok …

I echo what a few ppl already said. Service was awesome. The food and atmosphere were good but not particularly memorable that would make us return. I think if you were drinkers (we didn’t outside of the shots of soju they gave) you’ll …

C as in Charlie is a great spot with a creative and flavorful menu. The food is impressive—a unique blend of flavors that really shows off their creativity. The Korean Popcorn Chicken was the standout for me, packed with flavor and …

this restaurant is fantastic! the dishes are small so we were able to try several things and all were delicious. our server was great and super attentive to our dietary needs. we canât wait to go again :)
Amazing food, everything is perfectly seasoned and so flavorful. Their take on Salisbury steak and the oxbone pasta were particularly amazing. Would come back just for the oxbone pasta alone.
baby back ribs and pop corn chicken worth the trip
Very attentive and friendly service, great food, casual vibe.
We had a great meal! Service was thorough and warm, the food came out quickly and was all delicious and the space is really fun. Loved it!
Incredible. Order the mushroom bibimbap and bagel. Life changing.

Food was amazing at C as in Charlie -- we ordered 4 dishes and 2 desserts which was perfect for 2 people. The popcorn chicken is a must get! We also got the ribs, oxbone cream pasta and the fluke ceviche. Need to go back and try more of the menu! The service was also amazing -- very attentive and explained every dish which was very nice. We also got free sake shots which is always a plus!

Every bite is packed with flavor.  Unqiue dishes you can't find anywhere else.  Amazing service and everybody is super nice. And at these prices in the city!  We keep going back because it's that good.

Yu was an amazing waiter. She was on point and just beyond sweet. Everyone in this little, warm (in August) dining were genuinely happy to be there, as they shouldâve been.

The ribs and popcorn chicken are Korean flavored takes on classics that would easily bring folks to wait an hour at a food truck. From the first bite of the rib tapa, you know youâre going to remember this dish forever.

The other stand outs were the Mushroom Bibimbap and Seoulâsberry steak. Both are good looking dishes with enough familiarity to be comforting, while also being extremely unique.

This place is perfect for a lower key dinner for foodies like me. It will be by far the least expensive meal of the trip, but all of us know we found a special special spot already.
Food was delicious as always, service was super attentive. We love going there!
address: C as in Charlie, 5, Bleecker Street, East Village, NoHo, Manhattan, New York County, City of New York, New York, 10012, United States

At C as in Charlie, Salisbury steak is served on top of GruyÃ¨re grits with a galbi jus, and baby back ribs are glazed in harissa and gochuchang. Everything on the menu here combines Korean and Southern culinary traditions in fun, creative ways.

name: le gaz
reviews: ordered a vani muối latte and it was quite good — a bit pricey for the quality, though. the atmosphere and interior design was great, but maybe because there was a bit of a crowd, the barista was quite aloof

Small but mighty spot for Viet iced coffee. You can't miss it as you walk by and see the vivid red on the inside and the wall of Sua Ong Tho. Friendly staff too. The cafe is connected to the clothing store right beside.

I had a cà phê muối (Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk topped with salted foam). It tastes like what I had cà phê muối in Vietnam: bold robusta with a touch of sweetness and salt. The staff is friendly and welcoming. Very recommended.

Small coffee shop shop / cafe located inside of Fugazi, clothing store. small interior with some seating, plenty of light as well as seating outside on the sidewalk. there are a variety of signature coffee drinks and baked eats like …

Stepped in unexpected on the way to work in hot and humid summer morning. Known nothing about trending, but attractive by the shop design   wall decorations is like a statement. Vietnamese coffee added condensed milk, a nice relief for the weather
combined_description:
Google Maps: 4.6
(62)
·$1–10

name: Spot Dessert Bar
description: Trendy outpost mixing Asian elements like green tea & yuzu into cookies, cakes & boba drinks.
reviews: I discovered this place in the summer of 2024, and it was the first time I truly appreciated its environment. I took two pictures six months apart, and my second visit was enjoyable as well. The flavors and overall experience were still …
Smaller than I thought. Very lucky we beat the line cus it’s cold. However tables flipped fairly fast. …

The desserts are unique and pretty good. We don’t go here too often, as it is packed with tourists. You can register for the wait list online, you need to do that before you come, otherwise you can wait outside for 30+ minutes.

Absolutely loved it. Honestly we skipped dessert at another restaurant just to come here. Worth every penny. The model in the back round aka my future baby mama enjoyed the matcha beer with the matcha lava cake 5 stars extremely delicious. This is a Most Have guys trust me. I do wish the bathrooms were cleaned up But over all %100

Fun, surprising desserts with great combinations of flavors and textures. The golden toast is unassuming but delicious! I got the classic set & it was perfect to share with friends. Strawberries were under-ripe. Space is a little …
address: Spot Dessert Bar, 13, Saint Marks Place, Manhattan Community Board 3, Manhattan, New York County, City of New York, New York, 10003, United States
combined_description: Google Maps: Trendy outpost mixing Asian elements like green tea & yuzu into cookies, cakes & boba drinks.

name: Tigre
reviews: If you go with a reservation, you will wait less in line. Since we didn't have a reservation, we waited outside for half an hour, but it is a very enjoyable place. Their cocktails are very delicious but have a high alcohol content. Apart …
This is a place that you go to for the vibes. See my images. There is no easily identifiable entrance, but there is security at the door. Line that up with your GPS, you will find it. …

Tigre has a warm, sophisticated atmosphere with friendly staff. Coat check is available and encouraged immediately upon entering. I tried the channing carol and peachy pear cocktails, both wonderful drinks but loved the latter the most. …

Swanky date spot or drinks with friends. We both liked the prickly pear the most. The mister softee was okay and the cigarette was very strong and smoky! Bar seating is cute. Music is very loud but the staff are all very friendly. The GM (Daniela) is very sweet!

great vibe, recommend having a reservation. drinks were just okay, tried and couple and they were kind of just overdoing it. but would go again for the ambiance. very helpful & kind staff. cool matchbooks!
address: Tigre, 105, Rivington Street, Lower East Side, Manhattan Community Board 3, Manhattan, New York County, City of New York, New York, 10002, United States

name: Maison Premiere
description: Oysters, cocktails & small plates in a New Orleans-styled setting with an atmospheric garden.
reviews: I knew that Maison Premiere is known for their cocktails, but having dinner there really blew me away. Definitely the best meal I’ve ever had going out. The ambiance here makes you feel special and the service is even more special. All the …

Fun spot with the old school posh vibes. The staff is super friendly and kind. Excellent folks. Loved the drinks we got — the Old King Cole Martini and the Great Bambino. Definitely give this place a try if you like absinthe.

Maison Premiere is an absolute gem for seafood lovers and anyone seeking a romantic dining experience. While the service could be more friendly and professional, the dimly lit, beautifully designed interior exudes timeless charm, creating …
Cosy establishment with old school furniture and decor. It is such a warm feeling to visit. Oysters were good. The absinthe cocktail was alright.

We have visited Maison Premiere two times now, both experiences were different but satisfying. The first time we went to eat but just missed the kitchen/oysters, so we settled to just get cocktails. A unique menu with a true prohibition …
Excellent neighborhood restaurant - incredible food, drinks, and service. Each time we return, even when it's years between visits, we are always impressed by Maison Premiere.
Outstanding value during happy hour

I went under special pretenses.. I was supposed to take someone there but Those plans fell apart and I took someone else. The selection of food didnât appeal to me, Iâm not a seafood person. My partner enjoyed it though, which is what counts. She loved the oysters! And the drinks were great. It was very loud in there. Wasnât in the greatest of spirits but made the best of it. I doubt I would return there for the fact that the food selection I was not feeling. But if you like seafood then this is the place for you.

This little place is like stepping back in time in France.  We were greeted immediately and taken to a small booth in the back behind the bar.  I had mentioned in the rez that it was my mom's bday and they had a handwritten card for her on the table and then brought champagne!  Nice touch.  The oysters were amazing, the hamachi was so fresh and the scallops in brown butter....OMG.  Melted in your mouth.  We also got the lobster rolls where were delicious and had so much lobster...worth the money.  Our only thing was, being admitted wine snobs, we are spoiled in CA.  So the wine selections which are predominantly French were probably very good, we stuggled to find  a big enough cab to suit out taste.  (To each their own, we could have gotten a cocktail if we really wanted).  Either way, you MUST go here if you enjoy outstanding food and can appreciate a dimly lit little French hole-in-the-wall that isn't pretentious.
Perfect oyster date spot. Limited seating, so best enjoyed for a party of 2. Wide variety of oysters. Beautiful cocktails. A place that cares about quality.

We had a perfect lunch, perfect service and great ambiance, the food was excellent, did not find such a great place in New Orlean
Thaks for a magic experience
Georges masraff
Had a great time. Cocktails were delicious. Had as many oysters as possible.
Sat at back bar for MardiGras with the boyfriend, had a great time.

I donât know how Maison Premiere somehow makes every special occasion more special and more surprising! Itâs always been perfect, but each time is more perfect than the last. Iâll steal Ryanâs quote, âItâs the dream you never want to wake up from!â So true!!! Thanks so much to Ryan, Emanuel, Emeline (sorry about the spelling, Michael, Johnâs bananas foster (!), and every one else who works so hard and so brilliantly and so lovingly to make Maison Premiere our favorite place!
It was our first time here (Boyfriend and I). Our expectations were highly exceeded! We loved and enjoyed all of our food and drinks, especially the seafood!!
address: Maison Premiere, 298, Bedford Avenue, Williamsburg, Brooklyn, Kings County, City of New York, New York, 11211, United States

opentable_description: Maison Premiere serves a daily list of over 30 varieties of oysters along with an American seafood menu. Dishes include sea urchin, fresh crudo, and a selection of shared plates and entrees. The award-winning cocktail menu takes original inspiration from classic cocktails and re-imagines them as innovative, thoughtful expressions.  Inspired by New York hotel lobbies of bygone days, afternoons of leisure in Parisian cafes, and the charm of New Orleansâ Olde Absinthe House, Maison Premiere offers a truly unique dining experience.   The intimate space contains a small dining room, a horse-shoe shaped cocktail bar, and special counter seating at the oyster bar.  The full dinner menu is available at all areas of the space.  In the summer, from June to September, the lush garden provides additional seating amidst an enchanted scenery.
combined_description:
Google Maps: Oysters, cocktails & small plates in a New Orleans-styled setting with an atmospheric garden.

name: Una Pizza Napoletana
description: Modern space offering self-taught pizzaiolo Anthony Mangieri's 12-inch, wood-fired Neapolitan pies.
reviews: When a restaurant is named World’s Best Pizza as Una Pizza was in 2024—it becomes nearly impossible to get a reservation. And indeed, securing a table was a challenge. Reservations open exactly at 9 AM, two weeks in advance, and if you're …

Let’s keep it simple.

1. Get in line early, the place opens at 5pm and the line starts building at …

Making a reservation was a bit tricky—I had to be on the Resy app at 9 AM to book it for two weeks in advance—but it was worth it! When I arrived for dinner, there was no wait, and I was seated right away. …

The dessert was the best thing I’ve ever had in my life. The pizza crust was also amazing. Only down vote was that our pizza order was mixed up causing one to have added anchovies. Waiter was super nice and gave us free dessert but it wasn’t the best pizza I’ve had.

When I lined up in hopes of grabbing a walk-in dinner rsvp @unapizzanapoletana , I didn’t realize they were #1 on the 50 Top Pizza list for the US let alone #1 in the world for 2024!  We were in line chatting with some other avid pizza …

name: Tokyo Record Bar
description: Tiny izakaya offering prix fixe Japanese menus, à la carte dining & vinyl playlists.
reviews: Great vibes and good service, the food was decent. They said 8 dishes for the set menu, I get the cucumber and popcorn at the start counted as 2 because we only got 6 dishes. The sake pairing was every other dish and it wasn’t well timed. …
Most of the food was mediocre. The sushi rice wasn't even seasoned; I've never had such a bland bite of sushi before. Super not worth the price, just go to an actual Japanese place instead. …

Absolutely phenomenal experience! The hostess at the restaurant upstairs was not as welcoming but the staff downstairs completely made up for it. The kindness and hospitality were something my partner and I really appreciated. The food? Was …

This restaurant/staff/experience is all incredible and should be a “must do” on any NYC restaurant list. They accommodate vegetarian diets and allergies - include a note in your reservation. The food is incredible!!
I am pretty sure all of the negative reviews are from people who don’t understand the concept of this great, unique spot. …
title: Tokyo Record Bar  &  Tokyo Listening Room
combined_description: Google Maps: Tiny izakaya offering prix fixe Japanese menus, à la carte dining & vinyl playlists.

name: Super Taste
description: No-frills Chinese eatery known for hand-pulled noodles served with a range of meat, fish & broth.
reviews: The dumplings weren’t as great as everyone says, the chicken dumplings were definitely too dry, even with sauce or soy sauce, they still felt off. However, their beef noodles were amazing - rich, flavorful with plenty of veggies, making it …
Absolute perfection. I wouldn’t change a thing about this place maybe with the exception of more flexibility for vegetarian noodle dishes. But even so. …

Apparently this place is TikTok famous. We had stumbled on this place because it was one of the only places open later in Chinatown with great reviews. Super Taste definitely exceeded expectations. The prices are pretty standard for a bowl …

Super Taste, Super Flavor 🥟🍜✨
